page.title: 04HISTORIC BUILDINGS
page.content: Harrold Green contd. from the ground.The doorway is very narrow and is about five feet high.The cage was used for locking up drunks and criminals before sending them for trial in Sharnbrook. It would be the Vicar and churchwardens who locked them up because there was no police force. The third building on the Green is the war memorial built in l9l9, made of Aberdeen Granite and surrounded by a wrought-iron railing. One of the buildings surrounding the Green is the Roman Catholic Church.It was built in l864 and was originally the Harrold National School. A blacksmith's forge <now a private house> and a leatherwork factory <now demolished>are some of the other buildings around the Green. Adrian Tyas 3E Aged l2.
